channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12892] Add a class to allow taking a snapshot from the command line
item.description: It's easier to automate taking a snapshot from the command line than from the hbase shell. We should provide a command that can be called to snapshot a table.
item.summary: Add a class to allow taking a snapshot from the command line

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Patch with a better help for snapshot type

usage message looks like:


15:29:11 elliott@elliott-mbp hbase HBASE-12892 bin/hbase snapshot

2015-01-21 15:31:21,156 ERROR [main] util.AbstractHBaseTool: Required option -name is missing

2015-01-21 15:31:21,157 ERROR [main] util.AbstractHBaseTool: Required option -table is missing

usage: bin/hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.snapshot.CreateSnapshot <options>

Options:

 -h,--help                  Show usage

 -n,--name <arg>            The name of the created snapshot

 -s,--snapshot_type <arg>   Snapshot Type. FLUSH is default. Posible values are [DISABLED, FLUSH, SKIPFLUSH]

 -t,--table <arg>           The name of the table

against master branch at commit e87a69d9c0237fb8b1f5a1f22f699e4cc83c61c4.

Thoughts on this? It should be pretty un-controversial.
I've committed this to master, branch-1 and branch-1.0. Patch fails compilation with 0.98. Will open a backport issue shortly.
Thanks Enis. No need for a backport issue, let me look at this now.

Thanks Enis. No need for a backport issue, let me look at this now.
